meanings.sent1: The tall tree overshadows the small flower in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dark cloud overshadows the sun, causing a shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy overshadows the serious cat with its energetic antics.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter overshadows the quiet chatter of the other guests.
meanings.sent5: The mountain's peak overshadows the entire landscape, creating a majestic view.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem less important or impressive in comparison.
meanings.sent1: Her talent overshadows mine in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The grand fireworks display overshadows the small sparklers at the party.
meanings.sent3: The colorful painting overshadows the plain wall, making it look dull.
meanings.sent4: His remarkable achievements overshadows the efforts of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The bright spotlight overshadows the dim candlelight, stealing the attention of the audience.
